intro: Arundarbor glomerata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine, hairy texture. Its leaves are lance-shaped, serrated along the edges, and arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue or violet, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Arundarbor glomerata thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for gardens and naturalized landscapes.
